## Field.(constructor)

Constructs a new instance of the `Field` class

**Signature:**

```typescript
constructor(value: T | typeof Field.SKIP_SETUP, validator?: FieldValidator<T> | null, config?: FieldConfig);
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

value


</td><td>

T \| typeof [Field.SKIP\_SETUP](./blockly.field_class.skip_setup_property.md)


</td><td>

The initial value of the field. Also accepts Field.SKIP\_SETUP if you wish to skip setup (only used by subclasses that want to handle configuration and setting the field value after their own constructors have run).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

validator


</td><td>

[FieldValidator](./blockly.fieldvalidator_typealias.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt; \| null


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ A function that is called to validate changes to the field's value. Takes in a value &amp; returns a validated value, or null to abort the change.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

config


</td><td>

[FieldConfig](./blockly.fieldconfig_interface.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ A map of options used to configure the field. Refer to the individual field's documentation for a list of properties this parameter supports.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
